articles.headline: 73,000 Political Ads Test Even a City of Excess
articles.snippet: This year’s political advertising barrage is enough to shatter even Las Vegas-size notions of excess.
articles.abstract: This year’s political advertising barrage is enough to shatter even Las Vegas-size notions of excess.
articles.lead_paragraph: LAS VEGAS — No one comes here expecting anything in moderation. But to turn on the television these days is to shatter even Vegas-size notions of excess.

articles.headline: Nowadays, Wall Street Saviors May Wish They Weren’t
articles.snippet: The banks that bought up failing rivals are now being sued for the misdeeds of those firms before their rescues. Next time, Wall Street may be less cooperative.
articles.abstract: The banks that bought up failing rivals are now being sued for the misdeeds of those firms before their rescues. Next time, Wall Street may be less cooperative.
articles.lead_paragraph: “Would I have done Bear Stearns again knowing what I know today?”Jamie Dimon asked almost rhetorically last week at the Council on Foreign Relations in Washington.

articles.headline: Afghan Army’s Turnover Threatens U.S. Strategy
articles.snippet: The Afghan Army is so plagued with desertions and low re-enlistment rates that it has to replace a third of its entire force every year, officials say.
articles.abstract: The Afghan Army is so plagued with desertions and low re-enlistment rates that it has to replace a third of its entire force every year, officials say.
articles.lead_paragraph: KABUL, Afghanistan — The first thing Col. Akbar Stanikzai does when he interviews recruits for the Afghan National Army is take their cellphones.

articles.headline: After a Childhood Pouring Refills, Reaching Beyond the Past
articles.snippet: Bridgette Harvan, 21, has worked at her grandmother’s diner since she was 9. But as the breakfast regulars reminisce of better days in Elyria, Ohio, she dreams of a brighter future in a rejuvenated town.
articles.abstract: Bridgette Harvan, 21, has worked at her grandmother’s diner since she was 9. But as the breakfast regulars reminisce of better days in Elyria, Ohio, she dreams of a brighter future in a rejuvenated town.
articles.lead_paragraph: ELYRIA, OHIO — Bridgette the waitress glides through morning at Donna’s Diner with an easy, familiar air, as though she were born somewhere between the cash register and the coffee maker. She is a constant, like pancakes on the menu.

articles.headline: The BlackBerry as Black Sheep
articles.snippet: The phone once coveted by the elite and the powerful is becoming an object of ridicule as Androids and iPhones corner the smartphone market.
articles.abstract: The phone once coveted by the elite and the powerful is becoming an object of ridicule as Androids and iPhones corner the smartphone market.
articles.lead_paragraph: Rachel Crosby speaks about her BlackBerry phone the way someone might speak of an embarrassing relative.

articles.headline: Debt Impasse Shadows Race for Presidency
articles.snippet: The partisan fiscal showdown that is set to unfold in the weeks between Election Day and Inauguration Day is expected to set the tone for the next administration, no matter who wins.
articles.abstract: The partisan fiscal showdown that is set to unfold in the weeks between Election Day and Inauguration Day is expected to set the tone for the next administration, no matter who wins.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Obama and Mitt Romney will again debate their visions for the next four years on Tuesday night, and if the campaign so far is any guide, they will not acknowledge that the winner’s agenda could depend on the fiscal showdown between Election Day and Inauguration Day.

articles.headline: Europe Presses Google to Change Privacy Policy
articles.snippet: The company could face fines or legal action if it does not move to give consumers a better idea of what information is being collected and how it is being used.
articles.abstract: The company could face fines or legal action if it does not move to give consumers a better idea of what information is being collected and how it is being used.
articles.lead_paragraph: PARIS — What does Google know about its users and how does it know it? European privacy regulators on Tuesday warned the company to clarify those issues — or risk fines or other penalties by early next year.
articles.byline: By Eric Pfanner and Kevin J. O'Brien

articles.headline: Citigroup’s Chief Resigns in Surprise Step
articles.snippet: The resignation of Vikram S. Pandit comes after long-simmering tensions with the bank’s board. John P. Havens, the bank’s president and a longtime associate of Mr. Pandit, has also resigned.
articles.abstract: The resignation of Vikram S. Pandit comes after long-simmering tensions with the bank’s board. John P. Havens, the bank’s president and a longtime associate of Mr. Pandit, has also resigned.
articles.byline: By Jessica Silver-Greenberg and Susanne Craig
